subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Introduces sounds of spoken Korean, the writing system, foundational grammar, and socio-linguistic and cultural practices for communication of everyday service needs and basic information. Designed for true beginners with no prior knowledge of Korean. Students should contact instructor for a permission number to verify the requisite beginner status.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Develops fluency and broadens interactional skills for everyday communication in diverse social settings while consolidating linguistic foundation and conversational routines. Builds skills for reading and responding to complex sentences and simple informational texts. Prerequisite: Korean 101 or equivalent (knowledge of Hangul and listening and speaking ability to exchange rudimentary information in service and familiar settings). Students with equivalent preparation to the prerequisite course should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Develops fluency and broadens interactional skills for everyday communication in diverse social settings while consolidating linguistic foundation and conversational routines. Builds skills for reading and responding to complex sentences and simple informational texts. Prerequisite: Korean 101 or equivalent (knowledge of Hangul and listening and speaking ability to exchange rudimentary information in service and familiar settings). Students with equivalent preparation to the prerequisite course should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Develops skills for reading and responding to narrative and descriptive texts, advances conversational fluency, and cultivates socio-linguistic and cultural awareness for interaction involving different social relationships. Popular media as well as folktales are introduced for exposure to authentic language use and for discussion of evolving cultural norms and perspectives. Recommended prerequisite: Korean 102 or equivalent (ability to manage face-to-face service encounters and everyday conversation and to comprehend complex sentences and simple multi-sentence texts). Students with equivalent preparation to the prerequisite course should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Expands the scope of reading and discussion to a range of text types including expository texts. Develops skills for communicating meaning with increased accuracy and complexity. Students explore topics such as cityscape, pre-modern history, and environmental issues through course readings and materials and in student interest-driven projects. Prerequisite: Korean 203 or equivalent (ability to speak on familiar topics fluently, to read and understand simple stories and to write eligible sentences). Students with equivalent preparation to the prerequisite course should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Builds interpretive and presentational skills for communication on complex topics and develops solid understanding of the current issues of South Korean society in the perspective of social justice. Course reading and materials introduce on-going debates (e.g. military conscription, immigration, and education system) and and analyze how various media texts (e.g. newspaper reports and columns, TV news and programs, alternative media, organization websites, documentaries and feature films) treat the issues. Prerequisite: Korean 207, Korean 305 or equivalent (fluency in speaking, listening, reading narratives and descriptive texts and ability to write multi-sentence texts).

subject: KOREAN
descr: Issues in Korean Language and Society I
catalog_description: Surveys major historical events in building of modern Korean nation and state and reviews contentions over memorialization and historiography. Compares Korean and English history books, media coverage and cinematic representations for extended discussion, presentations and writing opinion pieces and essays. Prerequisite: KOR 306 or formal education in Korean at Grade school level. Students with equivalent preparation to the prerequisite course should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
descr: Korean Politics and Society: Academic Reading and Writing
catalog_description: Surveys the modern history of Korea through the prisms of music, investigating how the development of modern music in Korea, including the establishment and evolution of musical institutions and the changes in musical styles of Korean composers, is tied to the notion of national identity. Class materials are drawn from media and academic publications in Korean and written assignments guide students to develop skills in academic written communication. This class is designed for advanced students who have completed a fourth-year course in Korean or international students schooled in Korea. Students with requisite background should contact instructor for a permission number.

subject: KOREAN
catalog_description: Completion of a regular Korean class and a linguistics seminar. Topics vary from linguistics, language acquisition and teaching, and acquisition of a less commonly taught language. Learning Korean as well as the underlying mechanism of second language acquisition.
